model

Class ClassGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.ClassGenerator

  • public class ClassGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

    ClassGenerator

    This class create an object of the type class recieved. It get a string of all fields values, separated by a space. When finish creating the object, throws a notification to presenter.

    Author:
    Valentina Munoz & Moris Amon

    • Method Detail

      • initPrimitiveClasses

        private void initPrimitiveClasses()

        initPrimitiveClasses

        Create an arrayList of all primitive classes and variables.

      • createObjects

        public void createObjects(java.lang.String string,
                          java.lang.Class<?> myClass)

        createObjects

        Get the class type to create, and all it's fields values. When finish creating or an exeption was catched, send notification to presenter.
        Parameters:
        string - a string with all fileds vaules separated by a space
        myClass - class type to create an object of

      • setFieldsValue

        private java.lang.Object setFieldsValue(java.lang.String[] allValues,
                                        java.lang.Class<?> myClass)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception

        setFieldsValue

        Recursive method. Create an object of the received class. In a loop, set the value of each field. If the field is not of a premitive type, Call the function again with the field class type.

        Parameters:
        allValues - class fields values
        myClass - class type to create an object of it
        Returns:
        the object of the class type wanted with all fields set
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • makeAccessible

        public void makeAccessible(java.lang.reflect.Field field)

        makeAccessible

        If field received is not public, set the accessible flag of it to true

        Parameters:
        field - field to make accessible

      • createObjectByType

        public java.lang.Object createObjectByType(java.lang.String value,
                                           java.lang.Class<?> fieldClass)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception

        createObjectByType

        Get a value and a type to convert it.

        Parameters:
        value - value of the object
        fieldClass - type to covert the value
        Returns:
        the object created
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
